From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Spanish

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /apjaˈdaɾ/ [a.pjaˈð̞aɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: a‧pia‧dar

Verb

[edit]

apiadar (first-person singular present apiado, first-person singular preterite apiadé, past participle apiadado)

  1. (transitive) to cause pity
  2. (reflexive, + de) to take pity

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
